options.conditions: Must be clean, no stains, no bed bugs, no tears. Good condition only.
options.notes: Call for free truck pickup. Tax-deductible donation.

donation.notes: Most charities (Habitat ReStore, Goodwill stores, Salvation Army) do NOT accept mattresses in LA. St. Vincent de Paul is the main option. Always call to confirm current policy.

retailer_takeback.notes: California law REQUIRES retailers to offer FREE take-back when delivering a new mattress. Retailer has up to 30 days to collect old mattress.

cities.special_notes: Los Angeles is in California, an EPR (Extended Producer Responsibility) state. The $10.50 recycling fee charged at mattress purchase funds FREE recycling throughout the state. Some locations even PAY YOU $3 per mattress! Use ByeByeMattress.com to find the nearest drop-off location.

municipal_bulk_pickup.notes: Place items curbside by 6 AM on pickup day with 'Recology' sign attached. Cancel by 12 PM day before if needed.
